H518.def: = marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place

H6148.def: = action by which humans or deities take responsibility for someone else, taking upon themselves that person's obligations or vouching for that person's security

H7453.def: = the non-verbal sounds made by a large group of people in response to a situation, either positively or negatively

H3709.def: = the inner part of the human {L:hand<SDBH:יָד>}, but with special focus on the activities performed with it, such as holding, covering, or lifting objects, leaning on a staff, clapping, etc.

H3369.def: = causative action by which someone places a net or trap in such a way that it is not readily seen ► for the purpose of catching animals and birds; ≈ associated with aggression and oppression

H561.def: = words spoken by humans and deities; often remembered and recorded

H3920.def: = action by which humans or animals take control of (other) humans, animals, towns or land, usually with violence

H645.def: = particle linking two propositions, by which Y represents the purpose or result  of X

H6213.def: = causative action by which human or deities produce an object, either personally or by others on behalf of them

H5337.def: = causative action by which humans remove an object from a situation where it could be damaged

H7453.def: = the non-verbal sounds made by a large group of people in response to a situation, either positively or negatively

H3709.def: = the inner part of the human {L:hand<SDBH:יָד>}, but with special focus on the activities performed with it, such as holding, covering, or lifting objects, leaning on a staff, clapping, etc.

H1980.def: = process by which liquids or other inanimate objects move from one place to another

H7511.def: = action by which animals tread heavily and noisily on objects, ► resulting in destruction

H8572.def: = state in which humans are sleeping relatively lightly; ≈ sometimes associated with being inactive

H6079.def: = the folds of skin ► that cover the eye when closed

H5337.def: = causative action by which humans remove an object from a situation where it could be damaged

H3027.def: = the lower part of the upper limb of the human body, which in some contexts may include the full arm, ► apart from basic human activities such as holding, giving and taking, working, beating, also used in rituals around blessings, oaths, and prayer; ≈ used figuratively in expressions involving strength, control, responsibility, punishment; ≈ possibly used as a euphemism for the male genitals

H6833.def: = small bird, speckled brown in color; found in abundance around towns and settlements; lives on grass and grain; ◄ Passer domesticus, Passer hispaniolensis, and Passer moabiticus; ► clean and can therefore be eaten

H3353.def: = someone who has made it his profession to catch animals and birds with the help of nets and traps; ≈ associated with aggression and oppression

H1980.def: = process by which liquids or other inanimate objects move from one place to another

H5244.def: = small dark brown insect; its underground nest holds a queen ant, workers, and soldier ants that protect the nest; ant is capable of carrying many times its own weight; ◄ Messor semirufus or Harvester ant; ► symbol of diligence, hard work, and wisdom

H7200.def: = process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily --though not necessarily exclusively-- with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

H1870.def: = an open space connecting different places, ► used for travelling and transportation; ≈ often extended to denote our life as a journey from birth to death, and the totality of our activities during our lives

H2449.def: = state or process by which humans, deities, and animals possess or gain a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency

H834.def: = a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

H369.def: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non-existant

H7101.def: = a person who is acknowledged by a group as having authority over them ► to provide leadership, often in battle, and justice

H7860.def: = person selected from among a group of people to assume a position of leadership and responsibility

H4910.def: = state in which humans are similar in shape, behavior or experience to others

H3559.def: = state in which an object is firmly and immovably located in a certain place

H3899.def: = a staple food ◄ made from a dough of water and either wheat or barley then baked; ► together with water considered the very basis of life, often used to refer to food in general

H7019.def: = hot season of the year, opposite of {L:חֹרֶף<SDBH:חֹרֶף>}; ► time when most crops are harvested and preparations are made for the cold season; ≈ sometimes associated with excessive heat and drought, and also with hard work

H3978.def: = any nutritious substance that people or animals eat or drink ► in order to maintain life and growth

H4970.def: = reference to an unknown point in time; ► normally used with the purpose of finding out which point in time is intended; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that this point of time may never arrive

H5704.def: particle linking an event to a point in space; = relation indicating that event X ends at point in space Y

H7901.def: = state or action by which a human being or animal is in or assumes a horizontal position; ► in order to rest, sleep, or have sex with someone, or because of being unable to stand up as a result of weakness or death; ≈ sometimes associated with security

H4592.def: = small quantity of objects or substance

H8572.def: = state in which humans are sleeping relatively lightly; ≈ sometimes associated with being inactive

H2264.def: = action by which humans fold their hands together, ► probably in order to rest or take a nap; ≈ associated with being idle and laziness

H3027.def: = the lower part of the upper limb of the human body, which in some contexts may include the full arm, ► apart from basic human activities such as holding, giving and taking, working, beating, also used in rituals around blessings, oaths, and prayer; ≈ used figuratively in expressions involving strength, control, responsibility, punishment; ≈ possibly used as a euphemism for the male genitals

H7901.def: = state or action by which a human being or animal is in or assumes a horizontal position; ► in order to rest, sleep, or have sex with someone, or because of being unable to stand up as a result of weakness or death; ≈ sometimes associated with security

H7389.def: = state in which humans lack sufficient means to live at a standard that is considered normal; ≈ sometimes associated with laziness or foolishness, but ultimately determined by God

H1980.def: = process by which liquids or other inanimate objects move from one place to another

H4270.def: = state in which objects are found less in quantity or entirely absent in a location where they are supposed to be present

H4043.def: = a flat, usually round, object; made of wood or metal; ► used in battle; held by a warrior in front of him as protection from the weapons of his opponent; relatively small and easy to maneuver; ≈ associated with protection and therefore often used as an epithet for God

H1100.def: possible literal meaning: without benefit or without success; hence:  = state in which someone is considered an objectional human being who is engaged in evil behavior and does not contribute to the society in a positive way

H120.def: = human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; sometimes explicitly subdivided between {L:male<SDBH:זָכָר>} and {L:female<SDBH:נְקֵבָה>}; ≈ associated with mortality

H1980.def: = process by which liquids or other inanimate objects move from one place to another

H6143.def: literally: crookedness (of an event); hence: = state in which an event is considered morally and/or ethically unacceptable

H7169.def: = causative action by which humans press their lips together, ≈ which is associated with evil intent

H4448.def: = process by which plants and their products become devoid of moisture, and therefore lose color and bend over ◄ as if in mourning, ► which may ultimately result in death if circumstances do not change; ≈ associated with drought and destruction, often as punishment from God

H7272.def: = the lower part of the lower limb of the body of humans, animals, and --by extension-- of deities, which in some contexts may include the full leg; ► used for standing and walking; ≈ associated with authority, and also used as a euphemism for the male genitals

H676.def: = one of the five long and slender projections of the human hand; ► used for writing, pointing, grasping, and other activities; ≈ sometimes used metonymically to represent the entire body

H8419.def: literally: crookedness; hence: = state in which humans cannot be trusted to do the right thing or make the right choices in life

H3820.def: = the organ located in the centre of the human body that pumps the blood through our circulatory system, ≈ seen as the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief

H2790.def: = causative action by which someone makes incised marks on a surface of wood or stone with the help of a sharp and hard tool

H6256.def: = a shorter or longer moment in the passage of time

H7971.def: = causative action by which humans or deities commission one or more agents to go to a certain individual or place in order to perform a certain task

H343.def: = extremely difficult circumstances ► resulting in grief, poverty, sickness, and/or death

H6621.def: = a very short interval of time

H369.def: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non-existant

H4832.def: = causative action by which humans or deities help or cause (other) humans to be restored to health or physical strength after a disease or an accident

H8337.def: = state in which a countable entity is six in number

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H8130.def: = state in which humans or deities experience hostility towards a person, an object, or a practice

H7651.def: = state in which a countable entity is seven in number

H8441.def: = state in which an event is considered utterly wrong and detestable

H5315.def: = the part of the body connecting the head to the rest of the body and containing the passageways for blood, air, and food; ≈ associated with breathing, appetite, and life and often used metonymically to refer to the entire body and the personality inhabiting it

H8267.def: = state in which humans are not committed towards fulfilling their obligations and show that by their actions

H3956.def: = the fleshy organ in the mouth, used for tasting, licking, swallowing, and (in the case of humans) speaking

H3027.def: = the lower part of the upper limb of the human body, which in some contexts may include the full arm, ► apart from basic human activities such as holding, giving and taking, working, beating, also used in rituals around blessings, oaths, and prayer; ≈ used figuratively in expressions involving strength, control, responsibility, punishment; ≈ possibly used as a euphemism for the male genitals

H8210.def: = causative action by which humans pour out a liquid or dry substance

H5355.def: = state in which humans are not held responsible for actions committed in the past or for future commitments

H1818.def: = red liquid that circulates in the arteries and veins of humans and animals; ► used in rituals such as sacrifices, purification and covenant ceremonies, and never to be eaten; ≈ regarded as the seat of {L:life<SDBH:נֶפֶשׁ>}; human blood, when flowing from the body, pollutes the body and the land

H3820.def: = the organ located in the centre of the human body that pumps the blood through our circulatory system, ≈ seen as the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief

H2790.def: = causative action by which someone makes incised marks on a surface of wood or stone with the help of a sharp and hard tool

H4284.def: = procedure for achieving a certain purpose, originating from someone's לֵב mind

H7272.def: = the lower part of the lower limb of the body of humans, animals, and --by extension-- of deities, which in some contexts may include the full leg; ► used for standing and walking; ≈ associated with authority, and also used as a euphemism for the male genitals

H7323.def: = action by which humans walk at a relatively high speed

H4116.def: = action by which humans or deities act without delay

H8267.def: = state in which humans are not committed towards fulfilling their obligations and show that by their actions

H5707.def: = a person or deity who has evidence that something has taken place or that some decision has been made

H3577.def: = state in which something that has been said is not truthful

H6315.def: = causative action by which deities or forces cause air to blow from one place to another

H7971.def: = causative action by which humans or deities commission one or more agents to go to a certain individual or place in order to perform a certain task

H996.def: = the area separating two or mores locations

H251.def: = son of one's father, whether from the same mother or not

H5341.def: = action by which humans or deities carefully observe an object or event for a longer period of time

H1.def: = direct male progenitor; ► who normally provides protection, care, instruction, and discipline; ≈ is usually regarded with respect and associated with wisdom, security, and comfort

H4687.def: = causative action by which humans or deities prescribe or instruct (other) humans or themselves how to behave or respond to a situation

H5203.def: = process by which ropes that used to be tightly strung begin to hang loose

H517.def: = direct female progenitor; ≈ associated with affection and loyalty; often extended figuratively to refer to other objects that are regarded as feminine

H8451.def: = causative action by which humans or deities offer instruction to (other) humans, ► aimed to teach the recipients wisdom and good behavior

H7194.def: = process by which separate objects being joined together to form one unit

H3820.def: = the organ located in the centre of the human body that pumps the blood through our circulatory system, ≈ seen as the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief

H1621.def: = the front part of the neck, ► around which ornaments can be placed; ≈ only used in wisdom literature

H1980.def: = process by which liquids or other inanimate objects move from one place to another

H5148.def: = causative action by which humans or deities cause (other) humans or animals to move or be moved from one place to another

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H7901.def: = state or action by which a human being or animal is in or assumes a horizontal position; ► in order to rest, sleep, or have sex with someone, or because of being unable to stand up as a result of weakness or death; ≈ sometimes associated with security

H8104.def: = action by which humans or deities carefully observe an object or event for a longer period of time

H6974.def: = process by which humans open their eyes after sleep; ≈ also used in the figurative sense of becoming active after a period of inactivity, and of being restored to life after having died

H7878.def: = action by which humans produce inarticulate sounds expressing distress

H4687.def: = causative action by which humans or deities prescribe or instruct (other) humans or themselves how to behave or respond to a situation

H8451.def: = causative action by which humans or deities offer instruction to (other) humans, ► aimed to teach the recipients wisdom and good behavior

H216.def: = light as a physical phenomenon, mainly observed during daytime, and the opposite of darkness; ◄ one of God's most important attributes; first created by God and since produced by sun, moon, and stars, but also by fire; ► enables people and animals to see; ≈ associated with life, goodness, happiness, prosperity, security, favor, and wisdom, loved by the righteous, and hated by the wicked

H4148.def: = causative action by which deities offer primarily verbal instruction to humans, which may occasionally be accompanied by physical punishment, given as a result of misbehavior or to prevent misbehavior, ► aimed to teach the receiver (and sometimes other people as well) wisdom and good behavior

H1870.def: = an open space connecting different places, ► used for travelling and transportation; ≈ often extended to denote our life as a journey from birth to death, and the totality of our activities during our lives

H8104.def: = action by which humans or deities carefully observe an object or event for a longer period of time

H802.def: = woman of marriagable age or older, whether married or not

H2513.def: = object that is owned by someone; ◄ usually with the underlying assumption that it has been shared out to that person (or his ancestors) in the past

H3956.def: = the fleshy organ in the mouth, used for tasting, licking, swallowing, and (in the case of humans) speaking

H5237.def: = state in which something or someone is identified as different or strange from one's own perspective

H2530.def: = process by which humans or deities experience an eager desire for a person or object

H3824.def: = the organ located in the centre of the human body that pumps the blood through our circulatory system, ≈ seen as the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief

H3308.def: = state in which the outward appearance of humans or objects is pleasing to the eye

H6079.def: = the folds of skin ► that cover the eye when closed

H1157.def: = path through which a certain entity can be accessed, which can vary from a relatively narrow opening on one side to the entire surrounding space

H802.def: = woman of marriagable age or older, whether married or not

H3899.def: = a staple food ◄ made from a dough of water and either wheat or barley then baked; ► together with water considered the very basis of life, often used to refer to food in general

H5704.def: particle linking an event to a point in space; = relation indicating that event X ends at point in space Y

H3368.def: = state in which humans or objects are considered valuable and desirable

H5315.def: = the part of the body connecting the head to the rest of the body and containing the passageways for blood, air, and food; ≈ associated with breathing, appetite, and life and often used metonymically to refer to the entire body and the personality inhabiting it

H2846.def: = causative action by which humans take small objects from a particular location with an object shaped like a shovel ► in order to transfer them to another location

H2436.def: = front of the body of a human being, which, when a person is sitting down, forms a kind of platform that can be used for activities like throwing the lot, and that can even function as a sitting place for someone else, like a pet animal, a child or a beloved one; ≈ symbolizes affection and intimacy, and sometimes represents the entire person

H784.def: = state of burning, in which substances combine chemically with oxygen from the air and give out bright light, heat, and smoke; ► used for cooking, melting, cleansing, heating, and destroying; ≈ many aspects of life are compared with fire, such as anger, jealousy, aggression, wickedness, words, life, certain sicknesses, suffering, etc.

H899.def: = piece of cloth used to cover an object

H8313.def: = process by which an object is consumed by fire

H518.def: = marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place

H1980.def: = process by which liquids or other inanimate objects move from one place to another

H3554.def: = process by the human body is affected by fire

H7272.def: = the lower part of the lower limb of the body of humans, animals, and --by extension-- of deities, which in some contexts may include the full leg; ► used for standing and walking; ≈ associated with authority, and also used as a euphemism for the male genitals

H7453.def: = the non-verbal sounds made by a large group of people in response to a situation, either positively or negatively

H802.def: = woman of marriagable age or older, whether married or not

H5060.def: = process or action by which the hand or another part of the body of humans gets in brief contact with an object, whether deliberately or not

H5352.def: literally: to be cleaned out; hence: = causative action by which a city is deprived of its inhabitants

22.gl: to touch (a woman) > to have sex

H936.def: = state in which someone considers someone or something else unworthy of attention or respect, and shows that by his/her actions

H1590.def: = human who secretly takes possession of objects belonging to someone else, and sometimes even other humans, without permission or legal right and usually without intending to return it

H1589.def: = action by which humans secretly take possession of objects belonging to someone else, and sometimes even of other humans, without permission or legal right and usually without intending to return it

H4390.def: = state or process in which a certain location, container, or surface is filled or covered with so many objects that little or no space is left

H5315.def: = the part of the body connecting the head to the rest of the body and containing the passageways for blood, air, and food; ≈ associated with breathing, appetite, and life and often used metonymically to refer to the entire body and the personality inhabiting it

H7456.def: = to be in a state of wanting or needing food, but having little to no access to food

H4672.def: = process by which humans or animals discover the person, animal, object or location they were looking for

H7659.def: = state in which a countable entity is seven in number

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H1952.def: = a large quantity of valuable resources, ownership of which affects the way people think and live

H1004.def: = construction surrounded by walls and covered with a roof; ◄ normally made of stones, wood, or clay; ► to be used as living quarters, for storage, as a prison, as a sanctuary, etc.; sometimes used to denote a smaller part of a large construction

H5003.def: = action by which married humans have voluntary sexual intercourse with other humans who are not their spouse; ≈ often used as a metaphor for treachery or idolatry

H802.def: = woman of marriagable age or older, whether married or not

H2638.def: = state in which humans lack something that they are supposed to have

H3820.def: = the organ located in the centre of the human body that pumps the blood through our circulatory system, ≈ seen as the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief

H6213.def: = causative action by which human or deities produce an object, either personally or by others on behalf of them

H7843.def: = process by which objects are affected by violence, destruction, putrefaction, pollution, blemishes, and other factors that may have a destructive impact

H5315.def: = the part of the body connecting the head to the rest of the body and containing the passageways for blood, air, and food; ≈ associated with breathing, appetite, and life and often used metonymically to refer to the entire body and the personality inhabiting it

H5061.def: = a disease or sickness or wound ◄ caused by another person or sent from God or a deity ► to punish a person or nation for some wrong or disobedience

H7036.def: = state which provokes disdain from the general public or from a specific category of people ◄ due to one's behavior or condition

H4672.def: = process by which humans or animals discover the person, animal, object or location they were looking for

H2781.def: = state in which humans feel shame and humiliation, ◄ due to one's own shortcomings or misfortune and/or contempt from other people

H4229.def: = causative action by which humans clean or dry an object or body part by rubbing it with a cloth or with their hands; sometimes extended to refer to God; ≈ sometimes associated with destruction

H7068.def: = process by which humans or deities experience a sentiment of anger  for the sake of someone else, ◄ because that other person does not receive the attention, commitment, or treatment that they are entitled to

H2534.def: = poisonous fluid; ◄ secreted by serpents, scorpions, etc. and introduced into body of victim by bite or sting; ► used by these animals to kill their prey and/or defend themselves against their natural enemies; ≈ often used to denote suffering and injury in a more general sense as well

H3117.def: = the time of day that it is light, as opposed to the time that it is dark

H5359.def: = action in which humans or deities harm (other) humans in return for an injury or wrong, and so find relief from their anger

H5375.def: = process by which an object increases in height

H14.def: = state in which someone is willing to do something

H7810.def: = an object, usually of some value, given to a person; ► can be given without any expectation of exchange or often with the purpose to influence or persuade another person
